issues.text: whether a Receiver of an estate is an agent of the owners of the estate duly authorised to make acknowledgments under s. 19 of the Limitation Act

anchor.surface_text: The second contention urged by the learned counsel is that in any case an acknowledgment by the Receiver of an estate is not an acknowledgment by an agent of the owners of the estate duly authorised in this behalf within the meaning of Explanation II of s. 19 of the Limitation Act, and so is not an acknowledgment within the meaning of s. 19 of the Limitation Act.
